channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Researchers Turn the Tables: Scamming the Scammers in Telegram’s PigButchering Scheme
item.description: FYSA: Cybersecurity researchers have developed an innovative approach to combat "PigButchering" scams on Telegram, which involves cultivating false relationships with victims and deceiving them at the opportune moment. The operation involved creating faux personas, executing a sting operation, gathering intelligence, and siphoning off funds from the scammers' wallets.

item.title: New Spam Campaign Leverages Remote Monitoring Tools to Exploit Organizations
item.description: FYSA: A sophisticated spam campaign targeting Portuguese-speaking users in Brazil has been uncovered by Cisco Talos, exploiting commercial remote monitoring and management (RMM) tools to gain unauthorized access to victims' systems. The attackers use deceptive tactics to distribute malicious installers disguised as legitimate files related to Brazil's electronic invoice system, NF-e.

item.title: New Attack Exploits X/Twitter Ad URL Feature to Deceive Users
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Twitter; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability in Twitter's advertising display URL feature allows attackers to manipulate the platform's URL display mechanism, presenting a legitimate-looking link while redirecting users to a malicious cryptocurrency scam site. The exploit involves an inconsistent User Agent string and metadata retrieval process, allowing attackers to create a preview card that displays a trusted domain, masking the true, harmful landing page.

item.title: Guess Which Browser Tops the List for Data Collection!
item.description: FYSA: Google Chrome has emerged as the most data-intensive web browser among 10 popular browsers, collecting 20 different types of user data, including personal contact information, financial details, location data, and browsing history. Its dominance in the market, with a combined 90% share with Safari, raises concerns about users' privacy and highlights the need for evaluation of browser choices to prioritize security.

item.title: Qilin Leads April 2025 Ransomware Spike with 45 Breaches Using NETXLOADER Malware
item.description: FYSA: Threat actors with ties to Qilin ransomware family have leveraged malware SmokeLoader and a previously undocumented .NET compiled loader, NETXLOADER, as part of a campaign observed in November 2024. The loaders are used to deploy additional malicious payloads, including Agenda ransomware, and are protected by .NET Reactor version 6.

item.title: DOGE Big Balls Ransomware Leverages Open-Source Tools and Custom Scripts for Multi-Stage Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article describes a highly complex ransomware variant called "DOGE Big Balls," which incorporates political statements and taunts in its payloads. The ransomware's infection chain utilizes custom PowerShell scripts, open-source tools, vulnerable driver exploits, and red team frameworks, with frequent updates to evade detection.

item.title: Google links new LostKeys data theft malware to Russian cyberspies
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses the ColdRiver hacking group, a Russian state-backed threat actor that has been using new LostKeys malware to steal files in espionage attacks targeting Western governments, journalists, think tanks, and non-governmental organizations. The malware is delivered through social engineering attacks, such as ClickFix, which tricks targets into running malicious PowerShell scripts.

item.title: Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) Emerges as a Leading Framework for Cyberattacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: This article discusses the rise of Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) frameworks, which have enabled even less-skilled actors to orchestrate sophisticated attacks. The article highlights the shift towards cross-platform attacks, data exfiltration, and double or triple extortion tactics, as well as the increase in average ransom demands.

item.title: Iranian Hackers Posing as Model Agency to Target Victims
item.description: FYSA: Unit 42 has exposed a covert operation likely orchestrated by Iranian cyber actors that involves a fraudulent website designed to impersonate the Hamburg-based Mega Model Agency, with malicious JavaScript code aimed at harvesting detailed visitor data. The campaign suggests preparation for targeted social engineering and potentially aims to harvest credentials or deliver malware to specific victims.

item.title: Russian COLDRIVER Hackers Deploy LOSTKEYS Malware to Steal Sensitive Information
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses a sophisticated malware called LOSTKEYS, attributed to the Russian government-backed threat actor COLDRIVER. The malware is designed to exfiltrate files and harvest system information from targeted individuals and organizations, particularly those linked to Ukraine or Western governments. It uses a complex multi-stage infection chain, including CAPTCHA lures and PowerShell code execution, to evade detection and analysis.

item.title: AI-Driven Fake Vulnerability Reports Flooding Bug Bounty Platforms
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: AI-generated bogus vulnerability reports, or "AI slop," are flooding bug bounty platforms, mimicking technical jargon convincingly enough to pass initial scrutiny but crumble under expert analysis. These fraudulent submissions rely on systemic vulnerabilities within bug bounty programs and can erode trust, divert resources from addressing genuine vulnerabilities, and potentially dismantle the bug bounty model.

item.title: Microsoft Bookings Vulnerability Allows Unauthorized Changes to Meeting Details
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Bookings; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability in Microsoft Bookings allows unauthorized modification of meeting details, posing risks such as phishing, calendar manipulation, and information leakage. The flaw arises from inadequate input validation and sanitization in several key fields used by Microsoft Bookings, allowing malicious actors to inject arbitrary HTML content into confirmation emails, Teams invitations, and attached ICS files.

item.title: Nmap 7.96 Released with Enhanced Scanning Capabilities and Updated Libraries
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: This article is about the release of Nmap 7.96, a network mapping and security auditing tool. The update brings improvements such as parallel forward DNS resolution, upgraded core libraries, new scripting capabilities, and enhanced compatibility across platforms, especially for Windows users.

item.title: Cisco IOS XE Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Gain Elevated Privileges
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20197, CVE-2025-20198, CVE-2025-20199, among others; Summary: The IOS XE Software has multiple privilege escalation vulnerabilities that could allow attackers with existing high-level device access to gain root privileges, jeopardizing enterprise networks. Insufficient input validation in the command-line interface (CLI) of IOS XE Software enables attackers to supply crafted input and escalate their privileges to root on the underlying system.

item.title: SonicWall urges admins to patch VPN flaw exploited in attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SonicWall Secure Mobile Access (SMA) appliances; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32819, CVE-2025-32820, and CVE-2025-32821; Summary: The three security flaws can be chained by attackers to gain remote code execution as root and compromise vulnerable instances. Successful exploitation of the first vulnerability allows threat actors to delete the primary SQLite database, reset the password of the default SMA admin user, and log in as admin to the SMA web interface.

item.title: Security Tools Alone Don't Protect You — Control Effectiveness Does
item.description: FYSA: According to the Gartner report, misconfiguration of technical security controls is a leading cause for the continued success of attacks. Organizations are beginning to understand that having an average of 43 cybersecurity tools in place does not necessarily mean they have effective security controls. The article discusses the importance of continuous validation and tuning of security tools to ensure their effectiveness.

item.title: MirrorFace Targets Japan and Taiwan with ROAMINGMOUSE and Upgraded ANEL Malware
item.description: FYSA: The nation-state threat actor "MirrorFace" (also known as Earth Kasha) has been observed deploying malware called ROAMINGMOUSE as part of a cyber espionage campaign directed against government agencies and public institutions in Japan and Taiwan. The attack starts with spear-phishing emails that deliver a ZIP file containing a malware-laced Excel document, which is then used to launch the ANEL backdoor.

item.title: Spam campaign targeting Brazil abuses Remote Monitoring and Management tools
item.description: FYSA: Cisco Talos identified a spam campaign targeting Brazilian users with commercial remote monitoring and management (RMM) tools since at least January 2025. The campaign uses the Brazilian electronic invoice system, NF-e, as a lure to entice users into clicking hyperlinks and accessing malicious content hosted in Dropbox.

item.title: Cisco IOS, XE, and XR Vulnerability Allows Remote Device Reboots
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20154; Summary: The Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR software contains a critical vulnerability that allows unauthenticated attackers to trigger denial-of-service (DoS) conditions by forcing devices to reboot remotely. The flaw stems from improper handling of Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol (TWAMP) control packets, which can cause full system reloads on IOS/IOS XE devices or crashes of the ipsla_ippm_server process on IOS XR devices.

item.title: OpenCTI: Free Cyber Threat Intelligence Platform for Security Experts
item.description: FYSA: The article discusses OpenCTI, a free and open-source platform for managing and analyzing cybersecurity threat intelligence. It provides robust capabilities for structuring, storing, and visualizing technical and non-technical information, including integrations with popular tools like MISP, TheHive, and MITRE ATT&CK.

item.title: Russian Hackers Using ClickFix Fake CAPTCHA to Deploy New LOSTKEYS Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses a new malware called LOSTKEYS, attributed to the Russia-linked threat actor COLDRIVER. LOSTKEYS is capable of stealing files from a hard-coded list of extensions and directories, as well as sending system information and running processes to the attacker. The malware was observed in attacks on current and former advisors to Western governments and militaries, journalists, think tanks, and NGOs.

item.title: LockBit Ransomware Group Breached: Internal Chats and Data Leaked Online
item.description: FYSA: LockBit ransomware group, once considered one of the world's most prolific cyber extortion rings, has been breached by attackers, leading to the leak of operational data and internal chats. The exposed database includes sensitive information such as Bitcoin wallet addresses, negotiation chat logs, and plaintext passwords for 75 LockBit administrators and affiliates.

item.title: Cisco IOS XE Wireless Controllers Vulnerability Lets Attackers Seize Full Control
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco IOS XE Wireless LAN Controllers; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20188; Summary: A critical vulnerability in the Out-of-Band AP Image Download feature of Cisco IOS XE Software for WLCs allows unauthenticated remote attackers to gain full control of affected devices, enabling arbitrary file upload, path traversal, and execution of system commands as root.

item.title: Cisco Patches CVE-2025-20188 (10.0 CVSS) in IOS XE That Enables Root Exploits via JWT
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20188; Summary: The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-20188, is a maximum-severity flaw in Cisco's IOS XE Wireless Controller that allows an unauthenticated attacker to upload arbitrary files, perform path traversal, and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges. The feature must be enabled on the device for exploitation to occur; it is disabled by default.

item.title: LockBit ransomware gang hacked, victim negotiations exposed
item.description: Vulnerable Product: MySQL; CVE(s): CVE-2024-4577; Summary: The vulnerability is a critical and actively exploited remote code execution flaw in PHP 8.1.2, which was running on the server that stored the LockBit ransomware gang's affiliate panel database. This vulnerability allows for remote code execution on servers.

item.title: Measuring the US-China AI Gap
item.description:
FYSA:
As a cybersecurity analyst, I analyzed the provided article and found that it is an in-depth report on China's AI ecosystem, its growth, and investment trends. The report highlights the country's efforts to become a leader in artificial intelligence research and development.
The report provides detailed information about China's AI-related investments, including government-led initiatives and private-sector funding. It also touches upon the country's semiconductor industry, which is crucial for supporting its AI ecosystem.
From a cybersecurity perspective, this report does not specifically discuss vulnerabilities or threats. Instead, it focuses on the broader landscape of AI development in China and its potential implications for the global AI market.
However, one could argue that the rapid growth and investment in China's AI sector may potentially increase the risk of AI-powered cyberattacks or data breaches if security measures are not adequately implemented to protect against these threats.

item.title: Pakistani Firm Shipped Fentanyl Analogs, Scams to US
item.description: FYSA: This article appears to be an investigative report on a network of ghostwriting, logo design, and academic cheating services that are allegedly scamming individuals out of thousands of dollars. The report details the connections between various companies and individuals involved in these operations, including their use of Google Ads to promote their services. The article also discusses the difficulties faced by victims who attempt to seek justice through legal means.

item.title: WhatsApp provides no cryptographic management for group messages
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WhatsApp; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability in WhatsApp's group messaging feature allows a user to add someone to an existing group without their consent, potentially resulting in sensitive information being sent to unauthorized individuals. The weakness is likely to be exploited only in extraordinary cases, but it's still a good reason for groups trading sensitive messages to avoid using the app.

item.title: We have reached the “severed fingers and abductions” stage of the crypto revolution
item.description: Summary: No vulnerability mentioned; article discusses instances of physical violence and intimidation used by criminals to steal cryptocurrency assets from victims, highlighting the risks associated with publicly displaying one's wealth online.

item.title: PowerSchool hacker now extorting individual school districts
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PowerSchool; CVE(s): None; Summary: The hacker behind the December 2024 cyberattack on PowerSchool is now individually extorting schools, threatening to release stolen student and teacher data if a ransom is not paid.

item.title: CoGUI phishing platform sent 580 million emails to steal credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: A new phishing kit named CoGUI has been detected, sending over 580 million emails to targets between January and April 2025, aiming to steal account credentials and payment data. The kit impersonates major brands and uses a unique redirection system to target specific victims.

item.title: Hackers exploit OttoKit WordPress plugin flaw to add admin accounts
item.description: Vulnerable Product: OttiKit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-27007; Summary: The OttoKit WordPress plugin contains a critical unauthenticated privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2025-27007) that allows attackers to create rogue admin accounts on targeted sites by exploiting a logic error in the 'create_wp_connection' function. The flaw can be exploited via the plugin's API by sending requests mimicking legitimate integration attempts, using guessed or brute-forced administrator usernames, random passwords, and fake access keys and email addresses.

item.title: Top Ransomware Groups Target Financial Sector, 406 Incidents Revealed
item.description: Summary: Flashpoint analysts report that the financial sector has been heavily targeted by cyber threat actors between April 2024 and April 2025, with ransomware attacks being a significant portion. The sector's vulnerability to these attacks is due to its management of sensitive data and deep interconnectivity with other industries, making it a gateway for cascading breaches.

item.title: Play ransomware exploited Windows logging flaw in zero-day attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-29824; Summary: The Play ransomware gang exploited a high-severity Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) zero-day flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-29824, to gain SYSTEM privileges and deploy malware on compromised systems.

item.title: Agenda Ransomware Group Enhances Tactics with SmokeLoader and NETXLOADER
item.description: Summary: The Agenda ransomware group has been reported to intensify its attacks in the first quarter of 2025, targeting critical sectors like healthcare, technology, financial services, and telecommunications across several countries. The group has evolved its arsenal by integrating a newly identified .NET-based loader named NETXLOADER alongside the notorious SmokeLoader, which employs sophisticated obfuscation techniques and dynamic API calls to bypass traditional detection mechanisms.

item.title: NSO Group fined $167M for spyware attacks on 1,400 WhatsApp users
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): CVE-2019-3568; Summary: The article discusses a lawsuit against NSO Group, an Israeli spyware vendor, for exploiting a WhatsApp zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2019-3568) to install its Pegasus spyware on devices. The vulnerability allowed attackers to send specially crafted RTCP packets to target phone numbers, which would automatically exploit the vulnerability and install the spyware even if recipients did not answer the calls.

item.title: Doubling down: How Universal 2nd Factor (U2F) boosts online security
item.description: Summary: The article discusses the importance of online authentication, highlighting the limitations of using passwords alone and introducing Universal 2nd Factor (U2F) as a complementary method to enhance user safety. It outlines the benefits of U2F, including stronger security, user convenience, and wide availability, but also mentions potential challenges such as cost, education requirements, and physical risks associated with hardware tokens. The article concludes that while U2F is an emerging technology, it will be crucial in complementing password security in the future, with a focus on shoring up organizational password security.

item.title: Europol Shuts Down Six DDoS-for-Hire Services Used in Global Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: This article is not about a vulnerability. It appears to be a report on a law enforcement operation that took down several distributed denial of service (DDoS)-for-hire services, including arresting individuals and seizing domains associated with the platforms.

item.title: SpyCloud Analysis Reveals 94% of Fortune 50 Companies Have Employee Data Exposed in Phishing Attacks
item.description: Summary: SpyCloud's analysis of nearly 6 million phished data records reveals growing phishing attacks targeting high-value identity data, with key findings including the exposure of employee identity data at Fortune 50 companies, impersonated industries in phishing campaigns, and the importance of ongoing security awareness training and visibility into exposed identity data to prevent broader cyberattacks.

item.title: OttoKit WordPress Plugin with 100K+ Installs Hit by Exploits Targeting Multiple Flaws
item.description: Vulnerable Product: OttoKit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-27007; Summary: A privilege escalation bug allows unauthenticated attackers to establish a connection and potentially escalate privileges. The vulnerability is exploitable in two scenarios: when an application password has never been used or when an attacker has authenticated access to the site.

item.title: Medical device maker Masimo warns of cyberattack, manufacturing delays
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: Masimo Corporation, a medical device company, has disclosed a cybersecurity incident that has impacted its production operations and caused delays in fulfilling customer orders. The attack is believed to have occurred on April 27, 2025, and the company has isolated affected systems to prevent further compromise.

item.title: CISA warns of hackers targeting critical oil infrastructure
item.description: Summary: CISA warned critical infrastructure organizations of "unsophisticated" threat actors actively targeting the U.S. oil and natural gas sectors, highlighting the potential for significant impact including physical damage and disruptions. The agency advised network defenders to reduce risk by removing public-facing OT devices from the internet, changing default passwords, securing remote access, and segmenting IT and OT networks.

item.title: Android’s May 2025 Update Tackles CVE-2025-27363 & More – Langflow & MagicINFO Exploited, Kibana at Risk
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Google Android; CVE(s): CVE-2025-27363; Summary: A critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) flaw, CVE-2025-27363, in the Android System component allows local code execution without requiring user interaction or elevated privileges. This vulnerability is already being actively exploited and has been added to CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.
FYSA: The article discusses several vulnerabilities across various platforms, including Google Android, Langflow, Samsung MagicINFO, and Kibana. The article highlights the importance of patching and provides information on how to mitigate these vulnerabilities.

item.title: PoC Tool Released to Detect Servers Affected by Critical Apache Parquet Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Parquet; CVE(s): CVE-2025-30065; Summary: The Apache Parquet Java library's parquet-avro Maven module contains a vulnerability that permits unrestricted Java class references for string parameter coercion, allowing attackers to instantiate arbitrary Java classes with side effects. While full remote code execution is not possible, the risk remains significant for servers that can be coerced into instantiating classes with side effects. The F5 Labs "canary exploit" tool was developed to safely test for the vulnerability without causing unintended harm.

item.title: Healthcare Sector Becomes a Major Target for Cyber Attacks in 2025
item.description: Summary: The healthcare sector has emerged as a prime target for cyber attackers, driven by the increasing reliance on cloud applications and the rapid integration of generative AI (genAI) tools into organizational workflows. The report highlights the surge in malware delivery via cloud apps, mishandling of regulated data, and new vectors for data exposure introduced by genAI. It emphasizes the need for robust threat protection mechanisms, Data Loss Prevention (DLP), and implementing Remote Browser Isolation (RBI) technology to mitigate these evolving threats.

item.title: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GeoVision Devices; CVE(s): CVE-2024-6047, CVE-2024-11120; Summary: The vulnerability is an OS command injection vulnerability that allows malicious cyber actors to execute arbitrary commands on affected devices. This type of vulnerability poses significant risks to the federal enterprise and can be exploited by attackers.

item.title: SysAid ITSM Vulnerabilities Enables Pre-Auth Remote Command Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SysAid ITSM's On-Premise solution; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2775, CVE-2025-2776, CVE-2025-2777; Summary: A chain of critical vulnerabilities in SysAid ITSM's On-Premise solution allows unauthenticated attackers to execute remote commands by exploiting three pre-auth XML External Entity (XXE) injection flaws, enabling Remote Command Execution (RCE) as the privileged SYSTEM user on Windows servers.

item.title: SysAid Patches 4 Critical Flaws Enabling Pre-Auth RCE in On-Premise Version
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SysAid; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2775, CVE-2025-2776, CVE-2025-2777; Summary: The on-premise version of SysAid IT support software has multiple XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerabilities that can be exploited to achieve pre-authenticated remote code execution with elevated privileges. The flaws, tracked as CVE-2025-2775, CVE-2025-2776, and CVE-2025-2777, allow attackers to inject unsafe XML entities into the web application, enabling SSRF attacks and potentially remote code execution.

item.title: CISA Warns of Cyber Threats to Oil and Gas SCADA and ICS Networks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued an alert warning critical infrastructure operators of emerging cyber threats targeting Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and Industrial Control Systems (ICS) networks. The attacks are often basic in nature, exploiting well-known vulnerabilities and poor cyber hygiene among asset owners and operators.

item.title: Police takes down six DDoS-for-hire services, arrests admins
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports on a law enforcement operation called Operation PowerOFF that resulted in the takedown of six DDoS-for-hire platforms and the arrest of four suspects. These platforms were used to launch thousands of cyberattacks worldwide, disrupting online services, servers, and websites.
